text: Fernand Dupuy is a French politician. He was born March 2, 1917 in Jumilhac- le-Grand in Dordogne and died June 15, 1999 in Limoges. He was a member of the French Communist Party. He was general councilor of the Seine, mayor of Choisy-le-Roi and deputy for the Seine and then for Val-de-Marne. In 1948, he moved to Choisy-le-Roi to provide the secretariat for Maurice Thorez, a task he carried out until 1951, and from 1947 to 1964, he was part of the Central Committee of the PCF. General councilor of the Seine from 1953 to 1967, mayor of Choisy-le-Roi from 1959 to 1979, he sat in the National Assembly as deputy for the Seine, then for Val-de-Marne, from 1962 to 1978. == References == Category:Politicians from ÃŽle-de-France Category:1917 births Category:1999 deaths Category:People from Dordogne Category:French communists
title: Fernand Dupuy
